strings: <Cap><leader> discovers a new recipe for the alchemy pot!
<Cap><string_1> <equal> <Cap><string_2> + <Cap><string_3>
<Cap><string_1> <equal> <Cap><string_2> + <Cap><string_3> + <Cap><string_4>
<se_low>*: Ooh, we don't often get visitors here! Are you on your way to the castle?
<se_low>*: Then you must've come from the castle?
<se_low>*: You shouldn't be teasing a poor old man like me! I'd better get back to work anyway. The harvest waits for no man!
<se_low>*: Oh! Do you mean to say the period of mourning has finally come to an end!?
<se_low>*: What wonderful news! Be sure to tell my wife too. You'll make her day!
<se_low>*: Well, I don't mean to speak out of turn, but I'd turn back if I were you. It'll be a wasted journey.
<se_low>*: My granddaughter, Emma, works as a maid at the castle. She's a lovely, hardworking girl.
<se_low>*: She's not been able to take any holiday for these past two years now. I do miss her visits...
<se_low>*: Hm? The way to the castle? Just follow the path to the east and you'll come to it eventually.
<se_high>*: Meow meow meeeow!
<se_high>*: Sss sssss SSSSSSS!
<se_def>*: Have you, by any chance, come here looking for the mysterious legendary peak?
<se_def>*: Well, I found a strange old ruin at the top of the big hill upstream. But it was a bit of a let down really.
<se_def>*: It was just a crumbling old wall, nothing more. So I came straight back down again.
<se_def>*: All that trouble I went to, climbing up there and worrying that there might be a monster waiting for me around every corner...<page>*: What a waste of time!
<se_low>*: If you go round the back of the house and follow the river downstream a while, you'll come to a path down to the embankment.
<se_low>*: Once you're down there, turn around and head upstream. They say there's a cave somewhere over in that direction.
<se_low>*: The people round these parts don't go in there, mind.<page>*: Apparently, there's nothing on the other side of the cave but a boring old hill with a nice view.
<se_low>*: Yes, that's right. Emma's my granddaughter.
<se_low>*: I'm getting on a bit now, you see. So I know all the old Ascantha folktales.
<se_low>*: Let's see... An old story about making wishes come true... That must be the story of that strange hill upstream of here.
<se_low>*: It's said that if you go there on the night of a full moon and wait quietly all night, a door to another world will open.
<se_low>*: It's probably just a silly old fairy tale though. I'm afraid I can't tell you whether it's true or not.
<se_low>*: It gets so cold and spooky up there, you see. I've never known anyone willing to stay the whole night to find out! Ha ha ha!
<se_low>*: Let's see... An old story about making wishes come true... That must be the story of that strange hill upstream of here.
<se_low>*: It's said that if you go there on the night of a full moon and wait quietly all night, a door to another world will open.
<se_low>*: It's probably just a silly old fairy tale though. I'm afraid I can't tell you whether it's true or not.
<se_low>*: It gets so cold and spooky up there, you see. I've never known anyone willing to stay the whole night to find out! Ha ha ha!
<se_high>*: (Hiss hiss HISSS!)
<se_high>*: Miaow miaow MIAOW-OW-OW!
<se_low>*: I'm so excited! My granddaughter Emma's coming to visit for the first time in two years!
<se_low>*: Ah, thank you so much!
<se_low>*: A messenger from the castle came to tell me that Emma's coming to visit!
<se_low>*: I'll have to get cooking and put on a nice spread to welcome her back!
<se_low>*: Ooh, we don't often get visitors here! Are you on your way to the castle?
<se_low>*: Then you must've come from the castle?
<se_low>*: Then listen to a few words of wisdom from an old man. You're wasting your time going to Ascantha.
<se_low>*: Why? You'll soon see for yourself if you go. Anyway, it's getting late. I need to get some shut-eye.
<se_low>*: Oh! Do you mean to say the period of mourning has finally come to an end!?
<se_low>*: What wonderful news! Be sure to tell my wife too. You'll make her day!
<se_low>*: Well, I don't mean to speak out of turn, but I'd turn back if I were you. It'll be a wasted journey.
<se_low>*: My granddaughter, Emma, works as a maid at the castle. She's a lovely, hardworking girl.
<se_low>*: She's not been able to take any holiday for these past two years now. I do miss her visits...
<se_low>*: Hm? The way to the castle? Just follow the path to the east and you'll come to it eventually.
<se_low>*: My granddaughter's finally been allowed to take all the holidays she's missed these past two years.
<se_low>*: And her wages have more than doubled too! We're so lucky to have such a kind and generous King!
<se_high>Emma: Thank you for everything you did for the King in his time of need. I hope you'll drop in at the castle again one day.
<se_high>Emma: We're all so grateful to you. The King, me, and all the people of Ascantha!
<se_low>*: Ah-phew... ah-phew...
<se_high>Emma: Hmm...hmm...
<se_low>*: Hm...? Oh! It's you! How nice to see you again!
<se_low>*: Our granddaughter Emma's just come back to visit for the first time in two years!
<se_low>*: And it's all thanks to you. I can't tell you how grateful we are.
<se_low>*: Our granddaughter Emma's just come back to visit for the first time in two years!
<se_low>*: And it's all thanks to you. I can't tell you how grateful we are.
<se_high>Emma: I'll have to go back to the castle soon and attend to the King again. It's just...
<se_high>Emma: I don't know. It's so hard to break the news to them.
<se_low>*: I miss Emma so much when she's not around. I wonder when her next holiday will be...
<se_high>*: Purr purr purrplexing!
<se_low>*: Ah... Dear Emma... Come home again soon...
<se_low>*: Emma's gone back to the castle already. She still had a few days' holiday left as well.
<se_low>*: It's good that she's so hardworking like her old grandad here, but I hope she doesn't push herself too hard.
<se_low>*: I wonder if everything's all right at the castle. I hope Emma's okay...
<se_high>*: Purr purr purrgatory!
<se_low>*: I'm really pleased that Emma managed to make a life for herself at the castle.
<se_low>*: It's much safer for her there with the high walls and all the soldiers than it would be at this old shack.
<se_low>*: I just need to finish this bit off. Hold on a mo.
<se_high>*: (Yowwwwwl!)
The cat is yawning.
<se_low>*: I used to go travelling all over the place when I was younger.
<se_low>*: Seeing you reminds me of just how I used to be!
<se_low>*: Well! We don't often get travellers all the way out here.
<se_low>*: I don't have anything to offer you, but please feel free to stay as long as you like.
<se_low>*: Well, well. Fancy being out and about at a time like this! The Goddess must be watching over you and keeping you safe.
<se_low>*: Speaking of whom, have you heard of the goddess ring? It's supposed to bestow Her divine protection on the wearer.
<se_low>*: People say you can make it if you collect something called the ‘recovery ring’ and some orichalcum.
<se_low>*: I can't even begin to imagine what a beautiful ring it must be.
